lead_paragraph: Legal experts said the road to conviction was filled with significant hurdles, including a lack of forensic evidence related to the decade-old allegation by the woman at the center of the case.

byline.contributor: Jon Hurdle and Colin Moynihan contributed reporting.
byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and SYDNEY EMBER

headline.print_headline: Experts Foresee Obstacles for Both Sides in Cosby Case
headline.main: Experts Foresee Obstacles for Both Sides in Bill Cosby Case

snippet: Legal experts said the road to conviction was filled with significant hurdles, including a lack of forensic evidence related to the decade-old allegation by the woman at the center of the case.
abstract: Legal experts say Montgomery County, Pa, Dist Atty Kevin Steele will have significant hurdles to clear in prosecuting Bill Cosby for aggravated indecent assault on Andrea Constand; lack of forensic evidence and decision by previous district attorney not to prosecute aid in Cosby defense; however, deposition given by Cosby in previous civil suit and accusations by dozens of women may prove useful to prosecution.
